title: Nature walks showcasing Staffordshire mushrooms
text:
Eight weeks of Staffordshire roadworks set to start 
“There are some that have been recorded for years, over the last century or so. Some of them are quite tiny, pin-head-sized. 
“If you go out in the autumn you always find quite a few. We might find 20 or 30 species. If you go out in the summer, there’s far fewer of them about.” For more information on events in and around Staffordshire click here . What do you think? Be the first to comment 
But for the growing number of people interested in eating the mushrooms they find, it can be deadly. Mrs Traynor said: “Some people are very keen on finding edible stuff. But you have to be really sure that you’ve identified something.” 
For more information visit www.staffs fungi.org.uk Receive daily email updates from the Express & Star
